website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive rain gauge that's well made and easy to read.
pros: The plastic on this gauge can last for many years
Can be staked into the ground
cons: People in very rainy areas may want gauge that measures more than 5"

customer_reviews.title: 2nd One it leaked too!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I broke the first one, but with my second one see they both leaked from the seams. Not damaged just not made right. I don't know how the seams are so weak that water eats through it. It doesn't hold water! Go to the Dollar Tree and they are cheaper and last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy! The container lifts out of the stake so ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these after installing new sod. I did a lot of research after continuing to read how flimsy so many of these were and landed on this one. I am very happy! The container lifts out of the stake so you can easily read the measurement and it has held up easily to me moving them around almost daily. The dogs have even hit them a few times and we don't have any cracks or damage. Worth the money as they seem to last.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I'm ready - bring on the rain.
customer_reviews.text: We got 60 inches of rain this year - 2015 - North of Dallas - an all out historic yearly rainfall - I should have bought this in Jan - not in Dec. I remember - in one day this year we got 7-9 inches - this is a 5 inch rain gauge. Watch now that in 2016, we get 6 inches of rain. I have the tall unit on the fence in the backyard and spike unit in the front yard in a rocky ornamental area, so I dont destroy it with the law mower. I'm ready - bring on the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just received this... for the money, I like it. I see the dual gauges being good for here in the west, where rainfall is rarely more than 1" at a time, and surveying lawn sprinkler patterns is important. I plan on only having the gauge out a few months of the year, and plan to mount it carefully in a fabricated holder to avoid stressing the plastic. 4 stars only because I have not calibrated it yet. Even if it is off, can recalibrate it with a "Marks a lot" or equal.
customer_reviews.author: Aerodyne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Old version did not have marking on portion labeled as watering or sprinkling gauge. The double marking, on both lower section and upper section, makes it more difficult to read from a short distance. Ours is mounted on a wooden post that sits in the garden and although I may not be able to read exact amount, I can easily make a reasonably accurate estimate from a distance. That said, this is still my favorite rain gauge of all I have had through the years.
customer_reviews.author: Farmers Wife

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value, Dependable Years' of Service, Easy to Use and Read
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this rain gauge. My first purchase was 8 years ago and it performed precisely as I need it to. Eventually the sun's UV rays deteriorated the plastic and a crack formed the entire height of the gauge. Before purchasing another one of this model I considered others, but for the value received for the money spent, I could not identify another gauge that delivered so much for so little investment.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and convenient to use. Just one problem- ...
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and convenient to use. Just one problem- it doesn't tolerate cold weather-even here in mild winters in South Texas it cracks at temperatures below freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Miklos

customer_reviews.title: The big rain gauge however works great for seeing how much rain we got after a ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't seem to get a consistent read on the in ground sensor but that is most likely some sort of an issue on how my sprinkler hits the reservoir. The big rain gauge however works great for seeing how much rain we got after a thunderstorm. I nailed it to a post in our yard. No issues yet. UPDATE Oct 14 2015: Unfortunately the large rain gauge didn't last very long. I think the sun/heat caused it to get brittle. All it took was one good bump by a handyman walking through our backyard and the whole thing shattered.
customer_reviews.author: HCTB

customer_reviews.title: Good gauge for the price. Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. The plastic broke as I was pushing it in the ground the last time I used it. I have pretty hard soil and somewhat dry (hence why I bought the gauge to see how much water I am getting). I blame the ground more than the product
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: This item cracked the second time I emptied it! No it is not winter. It does not come with any way to mount it so I had to put a screw tightly in my deck to hold it. Maybe it was my fault for putting the screw in so tight but I didn't want it to fall off. It isn't worth sending it back and I can still use it but I would not buy it again. I bought it based on the great reviews and don't understand. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: ray k

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Rain Gauge
customer_reviews.text: I love having a rain gauge so I can tell how much rain we've had. My last one was more decorative and after several years the glass tube fell and broke. This is more untilitarian but it does the job, is easy to empty and it sits in the ground in my flower bed. It's hard to find a good rain gauge and I have one now!
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 4 Ragdolls

customer_reviews.title: My first one of these only lasted 1 year and ...
customer_reviews.text: My first one of these only lasted 1 year and it got a weather crack so it leaked water. That said, since it's so cheap, I ordered another one to see if it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Low tech is best
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to place. just jam it into the ground or in a pot and clean it out after each use and you now know how much it rained or how much you are watering. In California it's a must with the water shortage.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this mainly for the small gauge. I use this when I water my grass. Built well, not cheap. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Paulino

customer_reviews.title: Good Gage
customer_reviews.text: Living in an area where if you get one rain a month and not likely more than an inch it serves the purpose of giving me an idea of the rainfall. I whole heartedly recommend it for these types of climates.
customer_reviews.author: R E Rockey

customer_reviews.title: This is a great two-function rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: This is a great two-function rain gauge. I love that the top separates from the bottom so the bottom can be used when watering the lawn with a sprinkler. I know that you can use any container for this purpose, but this is a handy set up. I had one before but left it out all winter and it cracked. I am very happy with this replacement.
customer_reviews.author: All One

customer_reviews.title: High-Visibility Rain Gauge --  thanks
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality rain gauge, and can use to measure sprinkler output as well. Like the bright yellow color... our last clear one was mowed over. Hopefully, this one will be easier to spot.
customer_reviews.author: L.B.Redd

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this rain gauge. Is accurate, have checked it against a neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: The American

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Had this exact rain gauge before and it lasted many years until I made the mistake of leaving it out in freezing weather, where it cracked with the ice - my fault. So glad I found another! This hangs on my deck from a small nail - very practical to see easily and empty without bother.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Okay Rain Gage for Reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to , although it is rather difficult to keep clean inside (understandably). Also the fact that the plastic changes (from clear to opaque) due to exposure to the sun. So maybe place it in the shade, if that's possible. And yes, the sprinkler gage is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Zehler

customer_reviews.title: The base has its own measurements on it for the ...
customer_reviews.text: The base has its own measurements on it for the sprinkler gauge which get in the way of the writing on the rain gauge if you are using it for rain and not the sprinkler.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S Spatz

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: I use the rain gauge only. If you leave them out in the winter once temperatures go below freezing, they will crack, so I do have it replace it every few years. I've had probably four of them over the last 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Cubby

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and dependable rain gauge.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rain gauge and reports accurate rainfall totals. You can trust this gauge to provide you accurate rainfall totals when mounted properly. Easy to mount.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Just another piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. I had the larger gauge on a stake in my yard for one day before the attachment tab on the back broke off. Obviously this rain gauge is made from the cheapest possible plastic.
customer_reviews.author: TAP

customer_reviews.title: Price great. I could not find it in the box ...
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in only the sprinkler gauge. I hope they will make a pack for the sprinkler gauge only because I needed two. Price great. I could not find it in the box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Setholito

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This product is top-of-the-line in my book. I bought 2 in case one broke in freezing weather. Been through the worst winter in years here, still haven't broken in freezing weather. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: ... gauge that broke and it appears to be a pretty accurate rain range
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for a gauge that broke and it appears to be a pretty accurate rain range.
customer_reviews.author: Miller10

customer_reviews.title: Product is ok. Because of the sun's rays it ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is ok. Because of the sun's rays it doesn't last long. The rays damage it very quickly. I will probably order a product made from glass instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Newbie

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: It collects water and has measurements on it. what more is there to say. It does seem to be made of a cheaper type of plastic that will crack easily if mistreated. But it serves it's purpose. Helped me find figure out watering times I should use for a problem area in the lawn
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: and very easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Worked so well, and very easy to read. Do not leave out in the freezing cold. Duh... forgot to bring it in and it cracked. Will purchse another for next year and this time I will remember to bring in before the cold weather hits!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: hope this one last for a while just seems the weather gets them in a short period of time
customer_reviews.author: misty

customer_reviews.title: Eorks for me.
customer_reviews.text: Works good, don't let it fill and freeze. Second time buy for rain guage after freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Sprinkler and Rain Gauge
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for this particular rain gage in my shopping rounds. I found it immediately after looking at your site. We are happily measuring rain on our deck and in the front garden with this device. Great for simplicity, price and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: MKT

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Simple Excellent Gauge
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this gauge. Inexpensive, easy to use - numbers and markings large, clear, easy to read. Not flimsy - thick, hopefully durable plastic. Would make unusual, inexpensive small gift item for those with a meteorological bent.
customer_reviews.author: ldvliet

customer_reviews.title: but the spike is a little on the short side so it tends to get dislodged easily.
customer_reviews.text: Collects rainwater, but the spike is a little on the short side so it tends to get dislodged easily.
customer_reviews.author: CF.Crypto

customer_reviews.title: The right one
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gauge. Had one just like it for many years, which I broke. Glad to find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Rain Gauge!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase two of these as an add-on. Needed a replacement and this did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: SouthMouth

customer_reviews.title: Good rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: Rain gauge is the most accurate one we have ever used. We gave one to our son and he is very pleased with it also.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy as it only lasted a couple months
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for and was very excited to find. Not very sturdy as it only lasted a couple months. Could have been the squirrels, or the weather, either way I am in the search for a different rain gauge.
customer_reviews.author: swdogpound

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read increments and love the dual feature to record lawn watering as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C.

customer_reviews.title: we had one like this once before and it broke
customer_reviews.text: we had one like this once before and it broke. never could find on other one until i looked on amazon.im very happy I found the same one. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Toni Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Works better than my electronic one. Compared to several others, they all read the same. I assume that means it's accurate..
customer_reviews.author: De

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: looking for something cheap to uses to see how much rains we get and it turn out to be a better find and it was not made cheap.
customer_reviews.author: decoy727272

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It cheaply material, but for what you pay for it, if last a season it is sure worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Carson

customer_reviews.title: hope I have just as good as luck with this
customer_reviews.text: last one lasted five years, hope I have just as good as luck with this one
customer_reviews.author: nozama

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. You get two gauges in one which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce.w

customer_reviews.title: Like these
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for years and like them. We just have to remember to take it down in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple device, does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Park

customer_reviews.title: good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read, easy to empty. Very helpful check on the timing required for our watering system. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Wightman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice plastic quality. Perfect for measuring rain and lawn sprinklers.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Fragile polystyrene
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guage less than 2 years ago. It embrittled in this short period of time, and with sharp corners, became fragile and cracked. Cheap, but useless.
customer_reviews.author: cyclist Al

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Water beads up on the inside. Which makes it difficult to read.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Rain Guage
customer_reviews.text: The guage is hanging on my fence, easy off to empty and back on to keep tract of the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Loree

customer_reviews.title: Design
customer_reviews.text: On Designed for ground and needs to be redesigned so it can be screwed on a post and removed in one piece
customer_reviews.author: Ron SchwindtAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap effective sprinkler gauge.
customer_reviews.text: This offers a cheap and easy method to regulate sprinkling our yard. I recommend it and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Koch

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite rain gauges. Easy to install; no hardware required. Plus you get a two for one deal. Other rain gauges are harder to empty. This, you just pull the larger one out of the smaller one that is attached.
customer_reviews.author: David L Hutson

customer_reviews.title: Simple but it works
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to this but it works well. The Sprinkler gauge is surprisingly very useful as it helps calibrate irrigation systems.
customer_reviews.author: cwirons

customer_reviews.title: Versital and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: I have owened several of these rain gauges in the past. you had the lowest price and quick, cheap shipping. Thesee are versital am ndd can be placed in variouse locaations. One bad problem is if you expect temps to get below freezing make sure yoku dump the water out or it will crack!
customer_reviews.author: DOUGLAS

customer_reviews.title: Holds Water
customer_reviews.text: Its a rain guage. It collects water, and tells you how much has fallen. It seems to be made of durable material.
customer_reviews.author: denmac

customer_reviews.title: finally found it!
customer_reviews.text: I looked all over town for this. Should have gone too Amazon first. It is exactly what we wanted for a rain gauge!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: fits on nail on post
customer_reviews.text: it fits on the nail out of post to measure the rain..what I wanted. had one for years and could not find another till now
customer_reviews.author: S. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Bought for husband
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to see and read. We had one for years and it broke. We liked it so wheel we got another one.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Newby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use despite the lack of instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is a very accurate gauge. It is a bit pricey but power consumption is very low. It is also quite light.
customer_reviews.author: Foxboro

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I use the small gauge in my raised bed garden to measure how much I water (or rainfall). However I have little use for the larger gauge thus four stars. Very good quality. Easy to read, not cheap or flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Tezza

customer_reviews.title: Coincidental
customer_reviews.text: I was browsing in Amazon and saw the perfect mateto the simple rain gauge that I received two or three Christmases ago and which I use after every rain. I got it for my son, who recently moved to a new home on the theory that he will enjoy it as much as I enjoy mine.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but measurements aren't right.
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm not sure what exactly they used to mark out the measurements on these gauges, but they're nowhere near correct. That's too bad as they are nice enough for what they're used for, just completely useless to measure anything. I'll have to redraw the lines.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie and Max

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Inexpensive Rain Gage
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this rain gauge. I found it quite legible from a reasonable distance, it holds an adequate amount of water for the heaviest rain and easily mounts to a vertical surface. However, the plastic body is subject to becoming brittle upon continual exposure to sunlight. The mounting lip and a portion of the body eventually fell off and I was unable to mount it. However,it lasted over ten years and that's long enough! (Even broken, the intact part was still readable!)
customer_reviews.author: edcaroleg

customer_reviews.title: A better design could be had for the base
customer_reviews.text: It's very inexpensive. However, my moderately hard soil makes it difficult to insert the base. Using my palm, trying to press the base into the ground caused the base to crack and split. It still works (holding up the gauge requires very little security). Basically, the design is such that it must push out and expand the soil to make its way in. A better design could be had for the base. For the price though, it's working.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Way off
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t even have to pull a ruler or measuring tape out to notice that these inches are huge. Way off...didn’t even try it out because there was no point. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G

customer_reviews.title: Quality Item
customer_reviews.text: Hangs on a nail head in the fence. Easy to take down for emptying and hang back up. Water depth can be read from a considerable distance, maybe 25 feet. Should last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Kessler

customer_reviews.title: While the right price and reasonably easy to read
customer_reviews.text: While the right price and reasonably easy to read, this gauge seems to have a problem collecting water if the rain is hard. I think much of it is bouncing out. Whenever we get more than 1-2 inches of rain (common in Central Florida) my other gauge, sitting right next to it, will measure 20-50% more rain. The other gauge is taller and has a smaller mouth so I think that's why it keeps more water.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chubb

customer_reviews.title: primitive
customer_reviews.text: too small to be accurate and hard to hang without having some blockage from the rear of the gage.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Blue Ridge

customer_reviews.title: These are great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: So many of these rain gauges warn you not to let them freeze. Well, mine sits out in the weather year round. It's important you empty it more than it's important you not let it freeze. I get about three years out of these before I manage to break them. Be careful when you clean the inside to use a test tube brush or something similar rather than a sponge. After a couple of winters, it won't take a lot of pressure from an overly large sponge to cause it to break. Don't ask me how I know that.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Hanig

customer_reviews.title: You get two gauges...
customer_reviews.text: Two gauges come in each package.... one for measuring regular rainfall of greater than 5 inches... and a shorter one for checking water distribution from your sprinkler system... 1.5 inches. I set my auto timer for 30 minutes beginning at 4 a.m. Found out that my system puts out 0.7 inches... So watering twice a week gives almost 1.5 inches of artificial "rainfall! weekly. Just the right amount for the hard dirt under our lush green lawn! To use the bigger gauge, just stick it in the smaller gauge without having to put it on a stand. The small gauge has about a 4 inch spike coming out of the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Devout Patriot

customer_reviews.title: 2 in 1 guage
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a 2 in 1 gauge. the bigger portion fits into the smaller spiked portion. as such hooked together it acts as a very accurate rain gauge. taken apart the lower portion works as a sprinkler gauge when doing watering of lawns or gardens. both are easy to read. a great device and it works
customer_reviews.author: Norm springfield

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding items.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd set as the sun ate up my other 2 set's over a 48 year period. Helps me track the little rain we get in So. CA & helps control my lawn watering.
customer_reviews.author: Wm. H. Siegmund

customer_reviews.title: Check rainfall.
customer_reviews.text: Useful checking rainfall in your area. Helps with watering grass more accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Loren

customer_reviews.title: meets my needs
customer_reviews.text: Had this product before and made the misstate in leaving it out with some water in it in freezing weather. Would have given in a 4, but came with a chip in the smaller gauge (one supposedly can use for sprinkler systems), which now I do not know if will hold water for sure. It seems to be accurate enough for my use. Somewhat easy to read . My old one did not discolor after years of use.
customer_reviews.author: gary winter

customer_reviews.title: I buy one of these every couple of years. ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy one of these every couple of years. They'd last forever if I wasn't such an idiot by leaving it outside when we get a hard freeze before winter. Freezing water cracks it; my fault, not the device. Numbers and hash marks are clear.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis in MN

customer_reviews.title: If you use the rain gauge as one complete unit ...
customer_reviews.text: If you use the rain gauge as one complete unit as pictured, the first one inch is hard to determine without taking the full size gauge out of the sprinkler gauge. The measurement lines do not match up.
customer_reviews.author: Double Deck

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This replaced one I lost from last year. These are very reliable and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: measures rain, but don't break it
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly fragile item. Yank it, pull it wrong and it breaks, but leave it be and treat it nicely and it does the job. The rain gauge can be easy to let be, the lawn sprinkler is handy and even more prone to breakage since you may move it, be careful sticking it in to the ground. Be careful and both will last, but note they easily break. For the price, I'd say a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Meester Shack

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Hubby uses to measure the rain we get in our own little backyard weather station! For the price, you cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Don't let water freeze in it.
customer_reviews.text: Mine has cracked slightly after this long cold winter because I let one day freeze in it. That wasn't the only time it had a freeze but it was the coldest solid freeze. The crack doesn't allow it to leak yet so it still works. Freezing isn't its fault so I can't knock it for that. The lost star is for the slot they have for the screw when you want to mount it hanging. I'd have preferred a large more secure slot.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm!!! I find it to be very accurate...this is the second summer we're using it and cannot imagine being without this great gauge. In fact, I bought a spare, thinking being exposed to the elements may take a toll someday.
customer_reviews.author: MarieJoe

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: So simple to hang anywhere, great measurement, and you get the lawn sprinkler gauge with it (No More washing out cans to measure the sprinkler output!!). And, if you prefer you can put the rain gauge inside the staked sprinkler gauge to put the rain gauge in the ground if you don't want to hang. Perfect combo!
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product as it comes with a regular 5 inch ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product as it comes with a regular 5 inch gauge as well as a one inch gauge so you can just track a small storm for a whole month with a storms. Would buy again great price good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective design
customer_reviews.text: The graduation lines do not align when assembled. I am using my patched up o0ld gage which was damaged by hail. That one is no lo nger available.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Kelder

customer_reviews.title: This one too Fragile
customer_reviews.text: This the second one I bought. The first one lasted almost a year. This one broke in less than 2 weeks. I brushed up against it with my sneaker and it snapped off rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ray P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gage..
customer_reviews.text: This is our second gage from this manufacturer. Our first cracked but only after using it for15years. So we bought exactly the same gage again. Easy to mount and read..
customer_reviews.author: W. Torg

customer_reviews.title: working well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace another one that broke after our electronic rain gauge quit working. It seems to be working fine. Ordered two different types to check accuracy, and in the last month, they have been very close.
customer_reviews.author: jlm

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I love this design. The removable upper piece will gauge all but the biggest storms. The lower part is useful for monitoring lawn watering.
customer_reviews.author: Dogcatcher

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to read and empty
customer_reviews.text: I don't use the gauge with the spike but hang the other on the railing of one of our decks. It's very easy to read and empty. I've had several of these over the years and is better than others I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene M. Tangborn

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the small sprinkler rain gage and it works fine. The bigger rain gage will fit into the sprinkler rain gage so you can just stick it in the ground without finding a place to hang it. I do not use either a permanent rain gage. I put them out just when rain is expected then I can judge how much I need to run the sprinklers.
customer_reviews.author: Karlos

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: We keep one of these rain gauges in our yard at all time. My husband checks them daily during the rainy season and frequently other times. He records the amount of water both sprinkler and rain on his MoonDance, WallCalendar.
customer_reviews.author: Nayleeb

customer_reviews.title: Economical
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, it is excellent. Though lightly made, it measures rainfall accurately. My review would have been 5 stars if I had not touched it with my foot, breaking off the ground spike, which I put back with epoxy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Read
customer_reviews.text: It is, what it is. Simple to mount (with your own hardware if you want to hang it) and easy to read, there is nothing really special about it. Care must be taken to protect it from freezing weather
customer_reviews.author: TimeRanger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read, but they never hold up to exposure to sunlight. They always develop cracks and leak. I have had to buy new every season. Why can't these be made of a more durable plastic, or, better yet, pyrex?
customer_reviews.author: Silversmith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, measured nearly a foot of rain here so far in Northern CA.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: This rain gauge is simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This rain gauge is simple and easy to use. It can, however, a little difficult to read. My wife destroyed mine with the weed trimmer, so I replaced it with a clear plastic one from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: pmikejunot

product_meta.title: Springfield 2-in-1 Sprinkler and Rain Gauge
feature_bullets: This weather-resistant 2-in-1 rain gauge and sprinkler gauge features bold markings in inches and centimeters to measure rainfall.
Pair your reliable Springfield thermometer with a classic orange transparent gauge (sold separately) for measuring precipitation.
Springfield measuring basics offer quality and accuracy at a value price.
For over 50 years, Springfield has produced thermometers and gauges for everyday home use.
Choose the right Springfield product for your home and enjoy its accuracy for years to come.
